t: 1 Chronicles 16
Ministering Before the Ark
They*p brought the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they presented burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.
After David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.*s
Then he gave a loaf of bread, a cake of dates and a cake of raisins to each Israelite man and woman.
He*p appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord,*s to extol, thank, and praise the Lord,*s the God of Israel:

Asaph was the chief, and next to him in rank were Zechariah, then Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel. They were to play the lyres and harps, Asaph was to sound the cymbals,
and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
That*p day David first appointed Asaph and his associates to give praise to the Lord*s in this manner:
Give*pn praise to the Lord,*s proclaim his name; make*ld known among the nations what he has done.
Sing*ln to him, sing praise to him; tell*ld of all his wonderful acts.
Glory*ln in his holy name; let*ld the hearts of those who seek the Lord*s rejoice.
Look*ln to the Lord*s and his strength; seek*ld his face always.
Remember*pn the wonders he has done, his*ld miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,
you*ln his servants, the descendants of Israel, his*ld chosen ones, the children of Jacob.
He*ln is the Lord*s our God; his*ld judgments are in all the earth.
He*pn remembers his covenant forever, the*ld promise he made, for a thousand generations,
the*ln covenant he made with Abraham, the*ld oath he swore to Isaac.
He*ln confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to*ld Israel as an everlasting covenant:
“To*ln you I will give the land of Canaan as*ld the portion you will inherit.”
When*pn they were but few in number, few*ld indeed, and strangers in it,
they*ln wandered from nation to nation, from*ld one kingdom to another.
He*ln allowed no one to oppress them; for*ld their sake he rebuked kings:
“Do*ln not touch my anointed ones; do*ld my prophets no harm.”
Sing*pn to the Lord,*s all the earth; proclaim*ld his salvation day after day.
Declare*ln his glory among the nations, his*ld marvelous deeds among all peoples.
For*pn great is the Lord*s and most worthy of praise; he*ld is to be feared above all gods.
For*ln all the gods of the nations are idols, but*ld the Lord*s made the heavens.
Splendor*ln and majesty are before him; strength*ld and joy are in his dwelling place.
Ascribe*pn to the Lord,*s all you families of nations, ascribe*ld to the Lord*s glory and strength.
Ascribe*ln to the Lord*s the glory due his name; bring*ld an offering and come before him. Worship*ln the Lord*s in the splendor of his holiness.
Tremble*ld before him, all the earth! The*ld world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
Let*pn the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let*ld them say among the nations, “The Lord*s reigns!”
Let*ln the sea resound, and all that is in it; let*ld the fields be jubilant, and everything in them!
Let*ln the trees of the forest sing, let*ld them sing for joy before the Lord,*s for*ld he comes to judge the earth.
Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ld love endures forever.
Cry*ln out, “Save us, God our Savior; gather*ld us and deliver us from the nations, that*ln we may give thanks to your holy name, and*ld glory in your praise.”
Praise*ln be to the Lord,*s the God of Israel, from*ld everlasting to everlasting. Then*p all the people said “Amen” and “Praise the Lord.”*s
David*p left Asaph and his associates before the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s to minister there regularly, according to each day’s requirements.
He also left Obed-Edom and his sixty-eight associates to minister with them. Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were gatekeepers.
David*p left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the Lord*s at the high place in Gibeon
to present burnt offerings to the Lord*s on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with everything written in the Law of the Lord,*s which he had given Israel.
With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the Lord,*s “for his love endures forever.”
Heman and Jeduthun were responsible for the sounding of the trumpets and cymbals and for the playing of the other instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.
Then*p all the people left, each for their own home, and David returned home to bless his family.
